definition: to amass/to accumulate/to store/measured quantity (such as area of volume)/product (the result of multiplication)/to integrate (math.)/to solve (or integrate) an ordinary differential equation (math.)/old/long-standing
to go forward/to advance/to go in/to enter/to put in/to submit/to take in/to admit/(math.) base of a number system/classifier for sections in a building or residential compound

sentences.english: I am a well-disciplined, highly-motivated person with a strong desire to succeed.
sentences.chinese: 我紀律性強，積極進取，有強烈的成功願望。

sentences.english: With self-confidence, open mind, positive and creativity.
sentences.chinese: 自信，思維開闊，積極進取並勇於創新。

sentences.english: Enterprising and pioneering spirit, and work together for a better tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 積極進取的開拓精神，攜手合作，共創美好明天。

sentences.english: If you don't get on the ball and starts studying harder, you're going to flunk.
sentences.chinese: 如果你不積極進取，更加努力學習，你就人考不及格。

sentences.english: I don't, as I said, think we have a progressive party.
sentences.chinese: 如我所說我從不認爲我們有一個積極進取的黨派。

sentences.english: Finally , we need a more aggressive hvaa.
sentences.chinese: 我們需要一隊更積極進取的愉園。

sentences.english: The go-getter spirit of the millennial generation also comes into play.
sentences.chinese: 在千禧一代裏有積極進取精神的人也開始起作用。

sentences.english: New World Group is always dedicated to providing quality service for the Mainland and Hong Kong people.
sentences.chinese: 集團一向積極進取，致力爲香港市民及國內同胞服務。

sentences.english: If we do not move forward willingly then we will be moved sideways.
sentences.chinese: 如果我們不自動積極進取，我們就將被拋在一邊。

sentences.english: “Generics firms need to be nimble and aggressive,” he observes.
sentences.chinese: “仿製藥公司需要更加靈活精幹和積極進取”，他說。

sentences.english: They are not actively aggressive however they are sneakier .
sentences.chinese: 但是他們並不積極進取他們狡猾。

sentences.english: It's a very go-ahead company; they were among the first to introduce profit -sharing.
sentences.chinese: 它是一家積極進取的公司，他們第一個引進分紅制。

definition: full of youthful energy (idiom); vigorous/energetic/a bright spark
to bear hardships and work hard (idiom); assiduous and long-suffering/hard-working and capable of overcoming adversity
to love Hong Kong (usually implying that one also supports the PRC government)
to rouse to vigorous action/energetic mood
with great prospects for the future (idiom); well worth doing
